content.description: Stand Start using huge jug over lip and large ledge for feet.  Use cool underclings to access the lip.  Kinda high, kinda tricky.  Excellent for the grade.
content.location: Left side of front face of The blok.

content.description: Yet another Truc lowball.  Laydown/SDS at the left corner of the boulder similar to Grinding for Tips.  Thug your way up and over this lip to a HUGE jug, climb the fun slab above just R of the Arete.   Burly or beta intensive, bring your problem solving skills here.
content.location: Left side of front fact of the Blok, R of the tree.

content.description: Classic lip traverse! SDS with heel hook on left side of boulder. Traverse the overhang right for 12 feet and top out as for Driver 8.
content.location: On left side 100 feet from the trail, exactly opposite side of the trail from the Pocket boulder. Traverse the front of the boulder left of driver 8

content.description: This problem climbs the water groove located in the center of the front face of The Blok.  SDS on lowest edges at the lip of the boulder.  Left heel on the lip and right toe-hooking or campus.  Decipher the sequence to pull the bulge.  Looks easy, but it is pretty tricky.
content.location: Water groove in the center face of the Block.

content.description: SDS with marginal R heel hook, L hand undercling & R hand crimp out the overhanging corner of the boulder.  Unlock the beta and pull the slimpers to master this font-esque arete.
content.location: 50 feet from the trail, exactly opposite side of the trail from the Pocket boulder. Right side of the boulder.

content.description: Not to be missed if you love face problems, but has likely only seen less than a handful of accents.  Stand start on pockets and shallow edges.  Work up through some miniscule crimpers to a beautiful sloper topout.  Originally SDS, I have a feeling that the tree has grown enough to make the SDS more awkward.
content.protection: pad, landing looks sketchy but the crux and topout put you over the small boulder to the left.  Cover it with a second pad and it is a great spot to land.  It actually shortens the fall.
content.location: Located on the Left side of the Blok just left of a big tree.

content.description: 5 Feet right of the first slab problem is anther similar one, that is even easier and shorter.
Tall slab problem on the R side of the Block.  Stand start at the L side of the face and climb the tall slab.
